# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String; text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(text, " ")
    lines = String[]

    for word in words
        line = ""
        length_this_line = 0

        while length_this_line + length(word) > text_width && !isempty(lines)
            line = popfirst!(lines) * " "
            length_this_line = length(line) + text_width
        end

        if length(line) > 0
            line *= word * " "
        else
            line = word
        end

        push!(lines, line)
    end

    join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage:
wrap_string("This is a very long string that should be wrapped at 10 characters per line.")
```

Output:
```
"This is a very \nlong string that \nsshould be wrapped \nat 10 characters per line."
```
